description: A mixed use development to provide a two storey building (plus living accommodation in the roof space) comprising five shops (A1 use class) at ground floor level and eight flats to upper floors (first and second/roof levels); external pedestrian access ramp (to Devonshire Road); and cycle storage, vehicular access, service yard and landscaping.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | The proposed refuse storage and recycling arrangements indicated on Drawing 5009:HS.06 (received 14th February 2007) shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area,in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by theLocal Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | A landscape management plan, including long terms design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all landscaped areas, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the occupation of the development.  The landscape management plan shall be carried out as approved.  REASON: To ensure that the landscaping is maintained in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Prior to the commencement of the external landscaping/planting works, 600mm of clean fill shall added to all areas to be soft landscaped.  REASON:     In order to protect the health of future occupiers from any residual contaminants in the soil and to accord with policy 2.7 of the adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment 2004'. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before occupation of the development.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained.  REASON:	To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Notwithstanding the details of the proposed cycle parking area shown on drawing 5009:HS.06 (received 14th February 2007); plans and details of the covered cycle parking area shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority including the noise exposure category and/or the BS4142 noise level and the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation provided.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future residents/occupiers in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the dwelling above to demonstrate that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 (Leq 5mins),2300 - 0700hrs will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 (Leq, 1 hour), 0700 -2300hrs inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupartion of the development and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future residents in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level during the period 22.00 hours to 07.00 hours weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays by at least 5 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1 m from the nearest first floor or higher noise sensitive facade.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of near by occupiers in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | No deliveries to the retail units shall take place outside the hours of 08.00 hours to 20.00 hours, Mondays to Saturdays, and 09.00 to 17.00 hours Sundays and not at all on Public/Bank Holidays.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future residents/occupiers in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | The hours of operation for the retail units shall be limited to between 08.00hrs to 22.00hrs Mondays to Saturdays and 0.900hrs to 21.00hrs Sundays, Public and Bank Holidays.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future residents/occupiers in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | The five shops hereby approved shall not be amalgamated or otherwise altered so that the net floor area of any shop is increased.  REASON:  To ensure the shops are small enough in size so as to to only require small service delivery vehicles (vehicles of a size able to be accomodated entirely within the site) in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Before work commences, details of the treatment of windows to bedrooms 1 and 2 of proposed Flat 2 (first floor, indicated on Drawing 5009:HS.03 received 14th February 2007) to prevent overlooking to and from proposed Flats 4, 5, 7 and 8 (upper floor 3, indicated on Drawing 5009:HS.03 received 14th February 2007) shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.  Such details as approved shall be brought into use prior to the first occupartion of the development and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future residents/occupiers in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment 2004'. | Notwithstanding the information submitted with the application, details of siting and design of an automated entrance gate opening system, including details of any noise output from the gates to a maximum level agreed by the Council, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained permanently.  Reason: In the interests of highway safety, and in the interests of living conditions of adjoining occupiers and occupiers of the development hereby permitted, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 5.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan +Plan for the Environment+ (2004). | The development hereby authorised shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design. This shall include the provision of access controlled gates to the front of the site, and external lighting to the entrance and along the access road. Notwithstanding the information shown on the plans, details of all external lighting to be erected, shall be in compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers +Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution+ and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, and shall be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.   These works shall be carried out prior to the first occupation of the development, and permanently maintained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, +Plan for the Environment+ (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: Safer Ealing. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan +Plan for the Environment+ (2004). | The areas shown on the approved plans for access, loading,  unloading and manoeuvring shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only. 	 REASON:	To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site and to accord with policies 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan +Plan for the Environment+ (2004). | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application, access for disabled persons to the retail units from Northfield Avenue shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON:	 To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 5.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
